description: Issue Management - View, create, update, and manage GitLab issues from the terminal

userStories.title: Add issues API methods to GitLab client
userStories.description: As a developer, I need GitLab API methods for listing and fetching issues so that the UI can display issue data.
acceptanceCriteria: Add ListProjectIssues method to Client interface with state filter parameter
Add GetProjectIssue method to Client interface
Implement methods in client.go with proper pagination
Add mock implementations in client_test.go
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Display issues list in main panel
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a list of issues when I select the Issues view so that I can browse project issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Issues panel shows list of issues for current project
Each issue row displays: IID, title (truncated), state icon (open/closed)
Issues sorted by updated_at descending
Empty state message when no issues exist
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add issue detail view in details panel
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see issue details when I select an issue so that I can read the full information.
acceptanceCriteria: Pressing Enter on an issue shows details in the details panel
Shows: title, description, author, created/updated dates
Shows: state, labels, assignees, milestone if present
Long descriptions are truncated with scroll hint
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Filter issues by state
userStories.description: As a user, I want to filter issues by state so that I can focus on open or closed issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Press 'f' to cycle through filter states: All, Open, Closed
Current filter state shown in status bar or panel header
List refreshes automatically when filter changes
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add labels API method and display labels on issues
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see labels on issues so that I can identify issue categories.
acceptanceCriteria: Add ListProjectLabels method to Client interface
Display label names in issue list rows (max 3, with +N indicator)
Display all labels in issue detail view with colors if terminal supports
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add issue comments API methods
userStories.description: As a developer, I need API methods for issue comments so that users can view and add comments.
acceptanceCriteria: Add ListIssueNotes method to Client interface
Add CreateIssueNote method to Client interface
Implement methods in client.go with proper error handling
Add mock implementations in client_test.go
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: View issue comments in detail panel
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see issue comments so that I can follow the discussion.
acceptanceCriteria: Press Tab in issue detail view to switch to comments section
Comments displayed chronologically with author and date
Press Tab again to switch back to description
Show comment count in section header
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add create issue API method
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an API method to create issues so that users can create issues from the TUI.
acceptanceCriteria: Add CreateIssue method to Client interface with title, description parameters
Implement method in client.go
Return the created issue on success
Add mock implementation in client_test.go
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create new issue form
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create new issues so that I can track work from the terminal.
acceptanceCriteria: Press 'c' to open create issue popup/form
Form has title field (required) and description field
Submit with Ctrl+Enter, cancel with Esc
Success message shown and list refreshes on creation
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add update issue API method
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an API method to update issues so that users can edit issues from the TUI.
acceptanceCriteria: Add UpdateIssue method to Client interface
Support updating: title, description, state_event (close/reopen)
Implement method in client.go
Add mock implementation in client_test.go
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Quick action to close/reopen issue
userStories.description: As a user, I want to quickly close or reopen issues so that I can update issue status efficiently.
acceptanceCriteria: Press 'o' on selected issue to toggle open/closed state
Show confirmation popup before action
Update list item state after successful API call
Show error message if action fails
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Quick action to copy issue URL
userStories.description: As a user, I want to copy issue URL to clipboard so that I can share issues easily.
acceptanceCriteria: Press 'y' on selected issue to copy web URL to clipboard
Show brief confirmation message in status bar
Use appropriate clipboard mechanism for the OS
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Quick action to open issue in browser
userStories.description: As a user, I want to open issues in my browser so that I can access full GitLab UI when needed.
acceptanceCriteria: Press 'b' on selected issue to open in default browser
Use 'xdg-open' on Linux, 'open' on macOS, 'start' on Windows
Show error message if browser launch fails
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add comment to issue
userStories.description: As a user, I want to add comments to issues so that I can participate in discussions.
acceptanceCriteria: Press 'r' in issue detail view to open comment input
Multiline text input for comment body
Submit with Ctrl+Enter, cancel with Esc
Refresh comments section after successful submission
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Update help popup with issue keybindings
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see issue-related keybindings in the help popup so that I know available actions.
acceptanceCriteria: Add Issues section to help popup
List all issue-related keybindings: c, e, o, y, b, r, f
Show keybindings contextually based on current view
Typecheck passes
